alert.note: Alert for Graham; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 11:27AM MST until July 28 at 2:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Graham County in southeastern Arizona... East Central Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 230 PM MST. * At 1127 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar estimates over 2.6 inches of rain has fallen in the upper Turkey Creek and Sycamore Canyon drainages. Heavy rain is still occurring in this area. Water from these drainages will drain into Aravaipa Creek and eventually move toward the San Pedro River. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Aravaipa Canyon Wilderness. This includes the following streams and drainages... Aravaipa Creek, Turkey Creek, sycamore/Virgus Canyon and Fourmile Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
